articles.description: By which we mean, he reportedly tried to fire special council Robert Mueller. And that wasn't all the internet was talking about last week.
articles.title: President Trump's Attempt to Fire Robert Mueller Last June Tops This Week's Internet News
articles.author: Graeme McMillan

articles.description: President Donald Trump, an area man who believes cold weather disproves the theory of climate change, granted an ITV interview on Sunday to Piers Morgan, an equally pasty area man who has lots of extremely bad opinions about the N-word. Read more...
articles.title: Piers Morgan Interviewing Donald Trump on Climate Change Is the Lowest Circle of Hell
articles.author: Tom McKay

articles.description: Democrats have stepped up calls to protect the special counsel after revelations of the president’s attempt to fire him. But Republicans appeared to settle on warnings instead.
articles.title: Republicans Show Little Urgency on Legislation to Protect Mueller
articles.author: SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and NICHOLAS FANDOS

articles.description: The law of present day politics is as follows: For every Donald Trump tweet there's a Pete Souza Instagram just waiting to throw shade. On Sunday, Barack Obama's official White House photographer dug into his archives to unearth this absolutely beautiful, sty…
articles.title: Pete Souza's here to defend Jay-Z with the Obama-era throwback pic we all needed
articles.author: Nicole Gallucci

articles.description: The best thing about former Saturday Night Live players returning to their old stomping grounds to host is we can bet dollars to donuts they'll revive classic characters we know and love. Former president George W. Bush we know. Love? Well, Will Ferrell has s…
articles.title: Will Ferrell revives excellent George W. Bush impression to remind us that George W. Bush was not excellent

articles.description: US President Donald Trump talks Brexit and Macron in an interview with British broadcaster Piers Morgan.
articles.title: Trump critical of Theresa May on Brexit

articles.description: Jay-Z is the latest hip-hop star to reflect on what he sees as a silver lining to the presidency of Donald Trump — a theme that surfaced in hip-hop and some progressive circles even before Trump won the 2016 election.
articles.title: Why Jay-Z and these 11 hip-hop stars see a silver lining to Trump
articles.author: Deena Zaru, CNN

articles.description: Trump voters and a pastor ride along with CNN's Van Jones debating political issues including the removal of Confederate statues.
articles.title: Jones to Trump voter: What are we missing?

articles.description: As President Trump prepares for his State of the Union address, lawmakers still try to negotiate the terms for an immigration deal.
articles.title: Graham: We don't need $25B for a wall

articles.description: CNN's Randi Kaye talks to President Trump's female supporters to find out why they're still standing by him despite allegations of an affair with porn star Stormy Daniels.
articles.title: Female Trump supporter: I can stand proud again

articles.description: CNN's Van Jones examines the positive and negative impacts from the first year of the Trump presidency, saying that while the economy is improving, we are falling apart as a society.
articles.title: Van Jones: Trump is a tale of two presidencies

articles.description: Maine Republican Sen. Susan Collins said on Sunday that Congress should pass legislation to protect special counsel Robert Mueller following reports President Donald Trump considered firing him last June.
articles.title: Collins says it 'wouldn't hurt' for Congress to protect Mueller
articles.author: Eli Watkins, CNN

articles.description: LONDON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said he sometimes tweets from bed.
articles.title: Donald Trump says he sometimes tweets from bed: ITV

articles.description: LONDON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump has threatened to confront the European Union over what he calls "very unfair" trade policy toward the United States.
articles.title: Trump hints at retaliation at 'very unfair' EU trade policies

articles.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Congress should take a new look at proposed legislation to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller and his probe of the Trump campaign's ties with Russia after President Donald Trump's attempt to fire him last year, two Republic…
articles.title: Reports that Trump tried to fire Mueller prompt lawmakers' concern
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: LONDON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump would take a "tougher" approach to Brexit negotiations than Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May, he said in a television interview to be broadcast later on Sunday.
articles.title: Trump says he would negotiate Brexit with 'tougher' attitude than Theresa May
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: MONTREAL (Reuters) - Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Sunday set aside the nation's nonpartisan efforts to defend NAFTA, accusing his main rivals in Parliament of wanting to give in to hard-line U.S. demands for revamping the treaty.
articles.title: Canada PM: Opposition wants to give into U.S. demands on NAFTA
articles.author: Reuters Editorial

articles.description: Back on home soil, the Australian polymath discusses politics, musicals and #MeToo – and the worst year of his professional life Tim Minchin has segued from Donald Trump to homophobia, from race relations to nationalism. In his answer to a single question, he…
articles.title: ‘It was unbearable’: Tim Minchin on life under Trump and the collapse of his $100m movie
